symptoms.name: Jaundice (yellowing of skin and eyes)
symptoms.pattern: May be present or absent; often develops years after infection

symptoms.name: Symptoms of liver damage (e.g., stomach pain)
symptoms.pattern: May be present or absent; often develops years after infection

Alanine transaminase (ALT).abnormal_range: Sustained increase, usually 2-3 times the upper limit of normal; may be normal despite active liver inflammation in Hepatitis C

\u03b3-glutamyltransferase (GGT).abnormal_range: Often raised in Hepatitis C infection

Hepatitis B surface antigen (HBsAg).abnormal_range: Positive in most patients with chronic Hepatitis B infection

Viral RNA (Hepatitis C).abnormal_range: Presence confirms Hepatitis C infection; best test to determine infectivity and assess response to treatment

risk_factors: Blood contact (e.g., intravenous drug use, blood transfusions)

Liver ultrasonography.findings: May show normal or abnormal liver texture; abnormal texture may indicate cirrhosis

Liver biopsy.findings: Can assess the extent of liver inflammation and fibrosis

required: Evidence of chronic viral infection (e.g., positive HBsAg for Hepatitis B, positive viral RNA for Hepatitis C)
supportive: Liver biopsy findings consistent with chronic hepatitis
